titlePart.text: MECHANICAL METAL-WORKING WITHOUT ESSENTIALLY REMOVING MATERIAL

titlePart.entryReference: processes for changing of physical properties of metals ,

noteParagraph.text: Combinations of operations covered by different sub-classes of class are dealt with in . Combinations of operations covered by any particular sub-class with operations covered by other classes, e.g. with operations involving removal of material, are also dealt with in , except that if the operations covered by the other classes are subsidiary to the operations properly covered in a single sub-class of the combination is classified in that sub-class.
Processes of a kind covered by this class but applied to non-metallic materials may be classified here if they are applicable to metal and cannot be classified fully in one other class.

titlePart.text: WORKING OR PROCESSING OF SHEET METAL OR METAL TUBES, RODS OR PROFILES WITHOUT ESSENTIALLY REMOVING MATERIAL

titlePart.entryReference: operations of the kind involved in the manufacture of such products per se ,
cutting or severing devices or machines in general

noteParagraph.text: In so far as this sub-class provides for cutting or perforating of sheet metal or other stock material, attention is drawn to the fact that it does not include working of metal foils workable in a manner analogous to paper, which is covered by classes , .

titlePart.text: Straightening, restoring form or removing local distortions of sheet metal or specific articles made therefrom
Stretching sheet metal combined with rolling

titlePart.text: of hollow bodies made from sheet metal
of specific articles made from sheet metal, e.g. mudguards
